metadata.title: CVE-2022-42961 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in wolfSSL before 5.5.0. A fault injection attackon RAM via Rowhammer leads to ECDSA key disclosure. Users performingsigning operations with private ECC keys, such as in server-side TLSconnections, might leak faulty ECC signatures. These signatures can beprocessed via an advanced technique for ECDSA key recovery. (In 5.5.0 andlater, WOLFSSL_CHECK_SIG_FAULTS can be used to address the vulnerability.)

criterions.comment: wolfssl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
